sentences.en: Daylight came in through its glass roof; this was now the only illumination.
sentences.cn: 日光透过玻璃屋顶照入; 眼下这是室内惟一的照明.

sentences.en: Drugs are sold unashamedly in broad daylight.
sentences.cn: 在光天化日之下公然出售毒品。

sentences.en: Faint glimmers of daylight were showing through the treetops.
sentences.cn: 微弱的日光从树梢中透出。

sentences.en: If possible, it’s better to work in natural daylight.
sentences.cn: 如果条件允许的话，最好在自然日光下工作。

sentences.en: It has dawned but is not yet broad daylight.
It is easier to read by daylight than by lamplight.
sentences.cn: 在日光下读书比在灯光下读书舒适.

sentences.en: It was still daylight but all the cars had their headlights on.
sentences.cn: 还是大白天，但所有汽车的前灯都亮起来了。

sentences.en: Quinn returned shortly after daylight yesterday morning.
sentences.cn: 昨天早上天刚亮奎因就回来了。

sentences.en: The machines roar incessantly during the hours of daylight.
sentences.cn: 机器在白天隆隆地响个不停.

sentences.en: The park is open to the public during daylight hours .
The public square is as brightly lit as in daylight.
sentences.cn: 广场上灯火辉煌,如同白昼.

sentences.en: They emerged from the church into the bright daylight.
sentences.cn: 他们走出教堂来到明亮的日光下。

sentences.en: They're just ripping the fans off; it's daylight robbery.
sentences.cn: 他们这是在盘剥歌迷，简直是明目张胆的打劫。

sentences.en: Thick chipboard across the window frames blocked out the daylight.
sentences.cn: 装在窗框上的厚厚的胶合板挡住了白天的光线。

sentences.en: This medicine is not to be exposed to daylight.
Through the aperture he could see daylight.
sentences.cn: 透过缝隙，他能看见日光。

sentences.en: To get there on time we must leave before daylight.
sentences.cn: 为了准时到那里,我们必须在天亮之前离开.

phrases.tran_cn: 夏令时（指在夏季把标准时间拨早1小时）
在阳光中；光天化日之下；在大白天

trans.tran_en: the light produced by the sun during the day
